release_notes.en-US:
- updated locales
- allow alternative storage path for templates and scripts
- monospaced font in script editor
- fix default value for last seperator in TO variable
- change IMAGE variable to include entire image html tag per default
- do not add IMAGE variable in TEXT mode
- re-enable word wrap in template editor
- prevent users from using non-utf-8 files as input
- report correct line number of errors in scripts
- get rid uf XUL:stringbundle
- get rid of nested event loop and use async await instead
- fix groupbox caption on Windows
- fix ORGATT variable
- another fix for COUNTER variable

release_notes.en-US: Fix a bad bug in Thunderbird 38 which meant that the templates couldn't be read
Added a workaround so Thunderbird don't crash

- Support for Thunderbird 5, 6 and 7 and Postbox 2.5.
- A few bug fixes
The CURSOR-tag now works in Thunderbird 3
Added Thunderbird 3 and Postbox 1.1 support

Since there has almost a year since the last release new features has been added and many, many bugs has been fixed.

There seams to be a problem with the update function. To fix it just reinstall the extension again. No templates or groups are removed so you will see them again when you have reinstalled.
Some small bugfixes but also added support for adding text to the subject. Remember that the Subject that you chooses so if you want to add something to the subject use "My answer to: [[SUBJECT]]".

There is a lot of new things added in this versions. So please go to my homepage and read about it. For exampel I added keywords for text and the new [[CURSOR]]-tag. There is also possible to add your own tags and connect them to a javascript-function.
Same bug fix for Thunderbird 1.1
Now also translated to Italian. So now it is available in  de-DE, en-US, fr-FR, it-IT, ja-JP, ru-RU, sv-SE
Now if you have one text in a group the text is avalible directly.

This version makes people choose if they what to insert text or HTML and not like the old version when if you composed in HTML-mode the text automaticly inserted HTML (that why you had to use  and not [enter]).
Now supporting ru-RU
